newsitem.title: USA: Tenneco files shelf for $700 mln in debt.
newsitem.headline: Tenneco files shelf for $700 mln in debt.

text.p: Tenneco Inc filed Tuesday a shelf registration with the Securities and Exchange Commission to sell up to $700 million in debt securities.
Net proceeds will be added to the general funds and used for working capital and capital expenditures or to reduce indebtedness, Tenneco said in the filing.
Tenneco, based in Greenwich, Conn., is a holding company conducting all of its operations through subsidiaries.

Its major businesses are the manufacture and sale of automotive exhaust system parts and ride control products and the manufacture and sale of packaging materials, cartons, containers and specialty packaging products.
